column4: hey guys, having a bit of an issue with a bitlbee daemon. i've installed bitlbee 3.0.3 dev version from their repos, and when i start the bitlbee daemon `/etc/init.d/bitlbee start` it is the old 3.0.1 version
and the old version was installed how?
answer my question
i did. apt-get.
dpkg -l |grep bitlb
ii  bitlbee                              3.0.3+devel+802-1                          An IRC to other chat networks gateway (default version)
find / -name bitlbee |grep bin
I think the binary is nammed "bitlbee", adjust if it's not
/usr/sbin/bitlbee
and this is the only one? and if you run it, what version is it?
it warns me that i probably started bitlbee like that by accident :)
bitlbee -v or bitlbee --version, etc?
trying various combinations of flags from manpage to get an output
if i start it from cli like this, i have to use -D -n -v to cause bitlbee to start in daemon mode, not fork to background, and be verbose. but there is no output even with this
how do you know that it's 3.0.1 and not 3.03 when starting normally?
in bitlbee control channel "/ctcp root version"
CTCP reply from root: VERSION BitlBee 3.0.1-1build1 Linux/x86_64
then start it as you described above and query it via ctcp again?
no change still

md5sum your bitlbee binary. record the md5 hash. then purge all bitlbee packages. check that /usr/sbin/bitlbee does not exist. reinstall your developer bitlbee packages, do another md6sum on it and compare
thanks for talking it out with me. the init script for the daemon appeared to have a bug causing the process to not end when stop was called
